sentences.en: A host of problems may delay the opening of the Channel Tunnel.
sentences.cn: 可能推迟英吉利海峡隧道开通的问题一大筐。

sentences.en: at the opening of the trial
sentences.cn: 审判伊始

sentences.en: He squeezed through a narrow opening in the fence.
sentences.cn: 他从围栏上的狭窄缺口里挤了过去。

sentences.en: Hungary's opening of the border was a turning point for the refugees.
sentences.cn: 匈牙利开放边境对难民来说是个转机。

sentences.en: I glanced down at the beach as we passed an opening in the trees.
sentences.cn: 我们穿过林中空地时，我向下瞥了一眼海滩。

sentences.en: In some ways, the official opening is a formality.
sentences.cn: 从某些方面来说，正式的开幕仪式只不过是走个形式。

sentences.en: Man was drawing closer to the stars, opening new worlds.
sentences.cn: 人类在接近各个星球，探索新的天体。

sentences.en: Only the opening sequence could claim to be genuinely innovatory.
sentences.cn: 只有开场片段能称得上是真正的创新。

sentences.en: She then decided right before the opening to make a dramatic announcement.
sentences.cn: 然后就在开幕式开始之前，她决定要宣布一件激动人心的事情。

sentences.en: Soldiers had to make split-second decisions before opening fire, he said.
sentences.cn: 他说，士兵们必须要在开火之前作出瞬间的决定。

sentences.en: the chairman’s opening remarks
sentences.cn: 主席的开场白

sentences.en: The committee ruled against all-night opening mainly on safety grounds.
sentences.cn: 委员会反对通宵营业主要是出于安全方面的考虑。

sentences.en: The hallowed portals of academe were slowly and grudgingly opening to women.
sentences.cn: 大学神圣的大门缓慢又勉强地向女性敞开。

sentences.en: the official opening of the new theatre
sentences.cn: 新剧院的正式落成典礼

sentences.en: the opening chapter of the book
sentences.cn: 本书的第一章

sentences.en: The opening day of the battle was, nevertheless, accounted a success.
sentences.cn: 不过，开战的首日仍被认为是成功的。

sentences.en: the opening match of the season
sentences.cn: 本赛季的首场比赛

sentences.en: The opening of the scene depicts Akhnaten and his family in a moment of intimacy.
sentences.cn: 开头一幕描述阿肯那顿及其家人亲密无间的一个时刻。

sentences.en: The opening scene shows them celebrating their sudden deliverance from war.
sentences.cn: 开场的一幕是他们在庆祝自己突然从战争中解脱了出来。

sentences.en: The opening scenes of this movie are just not true to life.
sentences.cn: 这部电影开场的几幕真是太假了。

sentences.en: There are very few openings in scientific research.
sentences.cn: 科学研究领域很少有职位空缺。

sentences.en: They gave an insipid opening performance in a nil-nil draw with Peru.
sentences.cn: 他们与秘鲁队的揭幕战打得波澜不惊，最终以0：0战平。

sentences.en: We're talking to some people about opening an office in London.
sentences.cn: 我们在和一些人讨论在伦敦设立办事处的事儿.

words.tran_cn: 公开的；敞开的；空旷的；坦率的；营业着的
[五金] 开启工具；开启的人

phrases.tran_cn: 开盘价；按开市价盘；开盘指令；开盘委托
闸门开启高度；导叶开度
开学典礼；开幕式；开幕仪式；开幕典礼
（图书馆）开放时间；（书店）营业时间
开放，扩大开放；疏通，打通；开发矿山

trans.tran_cn: 开幕，开始，空缺的职位，[商]开盘，交易开始时间，（职位的）空缺
trans.tran_en: the beginning or first part of something

trans.tran_cn: （打）开( open的现在分词)，开始，睁开，启动
